alert.note: Alert for Chase (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 26 at 8:41AM CDT until May 27 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Wichita KS has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kansas... Cottonwood River at Cottonwood Falls affecting Chase County. Cottonwood River near Plymouth affecting Lyon and Chase Counties. For the Cottonwood River...including Florence, Cottonwood Falls, Plymouth...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cottonwood River at Cottonwood Falls. * WHEN...From this evening to tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Flooding of low-lying areas and cropland can be expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.0 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Cottonwood River Cottonwood Fall 9.0 8.0 Thu 7 am CDT 8.7 7.2 4.7 &&
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
